intro: Daucus gaditanus, commonly known as the Spanish cow parsley, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender stems and small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in grasslands and disturbed soils, reaching heights of up to 60 centimeters. Its leaves are finely divided and have a mild, aromatic scent, while its fruits are small, dry, and ridged. It is often found in open habitats and is considered a characteristic species of Mediterranean vegetation.
